page.title: 05MELKSHAM STATION
page.content: Melksham station was closed in 1966. The Great Western Railway originally owned it. The line was reopened because of public demand due to traffic congestion on the road to Swindon. The trains that run are diesel multiple units an the speed limits for them are 75mph on a straight track, and 30mph on a tight bend. Trains run to Swindon, Chippenham, Trowbridge & Westbury. If many people use the railway then more trains will run. On May 11 1985 the station reopened. A band played as the first train left the station. Fireworks went off as the train went over them.
